str2: Then, at that time. From ho and hote; the when, i.e. At the time that.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To begin. Middle voice of archo; to commence.
To curse, devote to destruction. From kata and anathematizo; to imprecate.
A prolonged form of a primary, but obsolete omo, for which another prolonged form omoo is used in certain tenses; to swear, i.e. Take oath.

parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular

str2: The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A man, one of the human race. From aner and ops; man-faced, i.e. A human being.
Immediately, soon, at once. Adverb from euthus; directly, i.e. At once or soon.
A cock, rooster. From aleko; a cock or male fowl.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From phone; to emit a sound; by implication, to address in words or by name, also in imitation.
